meanings.definition: The companionship of individuals in a friendly and supportive environment.
meanings.sent1: In the church, we enjoy the fellowship of our friends during Sunday gatherings.
meanings.sent2: The hiking club members formed a strong fellowship through their shared love for nature.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned into a fellowship of laughter and good food.
meanings.sent4: Their bond was a fellowship that weathered all storms.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of their fellowship made even the coldest days feel bright.

meanings.definition: A group of people sharing common interests or goals.
meanings.sent1: The book club was a fellowship of avid readers discussing their favorite novels.
meanings.sent2: The environmental fellowship worked together to clean up the park.
meanings.sent3: The fellowship of gamers battled through virtual worlds together.
meanings.sent4: Their fellowship in charity work made a real difference in the community.
meanings.sent5: The fellowship of artists inspired creativity in each member.

meanings.definition: The financial support provided to a scholar or researcher.
meanings.sent1: The fellowship allowed the scientist to conduct groundbreaking research.
meanings.sent2: She received a prestigious fellowship to study abroad.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected fellowship grant eased the burden of educational expenses.
meanings.sent4: The fellowship covered all her expenses during the research project.
meanings.sent5: His fellowship enabled him to focus solely on his academic pursuits.
